title: Become a Heritage Climate Guard
content: Are you working in heritage and want to help make historic houses more climate-resilient? Join the CliP-ComE Climate Guards, a European programme that connects EU climate goals with the local knowledge and needs of heritage owners, managers, and communities. What is a Climate Guard? A Climate Guard is a trained heritage professional—working in government, heritage organisations, or related organisations—who has specialist, up-to-date knowledge of...
creator: Editor

title: Developments of colorscans brings new life to tapestry
content: Europe’s rich tapestry tradition has long dazzled with its intricate patterns, vibrant scenes, and storytelling power. Once the preserve of medieval castles, Renaissance palaces, and stately homes, tapestries today face a future clouded by age, color loss, and, too often, fading interest. But the past decade has seen remarkable breakthroughs in digital color scanning—or “colorscans”—that are giving centuries-old masterpieces a new lease on life and transforming approaches to conservation, virtua...
creator: EHT

title: Preserve your bars, they’ll be gone before you know it
content: European heritage has long been defined by its grand cathedrals, ancient monuments, and iconic art collections. Yet, some of the continent’s liveliest and most beloved heritage sites are humbler: the local bars, cafés, and pubs that weave together day-to-day life. These vibrant social spaces—where generations share stories, ideas, and laughter—are facing a quiet but pronounced crisis. As a new wave of urban development and regulatory pressures spreads across Europe, professionals in the heritage...
creator: Editor

title: Strengthen Your Heritage Impact – Free certified trainer course this June in Amsterdam
content: CliP-ComE – Climate Protection Competences for European Historic Houses We are pleased to invite you to a three-day in-person Training of Trainers for Cultural Heritage, organised as part of the CliP-ComE (Climate Protection Competences in European Historic Houses) project. This training is tailored for owners and managers of historic houses, as well as professionals interested in becoming trainers on topics relevant to the cultural heritage ecosystem. Training DetailsLocation: IVEM Heritage &#3...
creator: Editor

title: More Than Just Insulation: A Holistic Approach to Energy Efficiency in Historic Buildings
content: The transition to a more sustainable built environment is high on the European agenda. Historic buildings – from castles and manor houses to entire old town centres – are not exempt from this challenge. In fact, they offer unique opportunities. CliP-ComEThis year, a new European initiative titled “CliP ComE” (Climate Protection Competences for European Historic Houses) will be launched as a pilot to help private owners of historic houses make their buildings more sustainable. Develop...
creator: Editor

title: CliP-ComE: European project for improving the energy efficiency of Country estates, Castles, and Mansions
content: The CliP-ComE project (Climate Protection Competences for European Historic Houses) is a groundbreaking European initiative designed to address energy efficiency and sustainability in private historic houses—castles, country estates, and mansions. By equipping owners and managers of these historic properties with essential skills and knowledge, the project aims to reduce CO₂ emissions while preserving Europe’s cultural heritage. Building on the success of the PRO-Heritage project from 2021, whic...
creator: Editor

title: Heritage in Ashes: The Urgency of Better Fire Protection Strategies
content: While cycling to work last week, Brian Mikkelsen noticed flames and smoke from his workplace. A tragedy under any circumstance, but here’s the catch: Mikkelsen’s office is Denmark’s historic stock exchange building, Börsen. Whilst firefighters and brave volunteers were able to retrieve much of the historic art collection before it succumbed to the flames, the building itself was dramatically damaged before firefighters could control the blaze. Whilst immediate comparisons were ...
creator: Editor

title: European Commission Considers Exemptions for Lead Use in Cultural Preservation
content: In a recent petition, artisans across Europe have raised concerns over the potential ban on the use of lead in cultural heritage conservation. The European Chemicals Agency (ECHA) is considering adding lead, a material integral to various traditional crafts, to the list of substances requiring authorization under the REACH regulation. Ivo Rauch, representing German artisans and a member of the International Scientific Committee for the Conservation of Stained Glass, emphasized the vital role of ...
creator: Editor

title: Seven New Sites Receive the Prestigious European Heritage Label
content: On Wednesday evening, April 17, 2024, EU Commissioner Iliana Ivanova hosted an award ceremony at the Elisabeth Center in Antwerp. During this event, the European Commission proudly announced the recipients of the 2023 European Heritage Label. This prestigious honor is awarded to sites throughout Europe that exemplify the continent’s rich history and shared values, and that have played a significant role in the development of the European Union. Established in 2011, the European Heritage La...
creator: Editor

title: Assembly Great Spa Towns of Europe: A Convergence of Culture and Conservation
content: This week, the picturesque town of Bad Kissingen, Germany, served as the gathering point for members of the Great Spa Towns of Europe (GSTE) Association. The assembly, which drew attendees for a series of meetings and site visits, was graciously hosted by Dr. Dirk Vogel, Lord Mayor of Bad Kissingen. The GSTE’s General Assembly aligned with the International Day for Monuments and Sites, providing a profound backdrop for discussions centered on the historic and pacific role of spa towns in [...
creator: Editor
